page.title: 03THE RESERVE'S FLORA & FAUNA
page.content:
The Reserve is a favourite wintering place for tremendous numbers of wild geese, especially Pinkfoot. In summer vast numbers of birds choose the area as a breeding ground, Terns particularly. All five species of Britain's terns have been known to breed in the bay. Their favourite nesting ground is the sand bar at the eastern end of the bay. Many other wildfowl frequent the environs of the bay.
The eastern edge saltings also provide an interesting habitat for many varieties of wild flowers and their associated visitors. The Reserve occupies a junction between the nothern and southern limits of colonisation for various species of plants and animals. Flowers which can be found in prolific numbers include
